content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Fair clash, should be easy to solve for almost anyone.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: This is a nice question I would like to see in Clash of Code mode.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: That's a fun clash

(Btw, you should correct the 4th paragraph in the Goal section to "If more than 10 sheep are remaining after...." (or correction like that))

Goal
* Paragraph 2
(a) Suggest to add "At the beginning".

(b) Please delete "greater than". ("4 times greater than" = "5 times".)

* Based on your solution, it seems that "more than" rather than "fewer than" 10 sheep will lead to the doubling in the number of wolves.

* Please format "Yes" and "No" as {{constants}}.

Input
* Please rewrite the entire section as follows:
<<Line 1>>: Two space-separated integers [[grayWolves]] and [[blackWolves]] for the number of gray wolves and black wolves at the beginning respectively.

Output
* Please add this at the beginning:
<<Line 1>>: Three space-separated integers/strings:

* Please format "Yes" and "No" as {{constants}}.

Constraints
* Please change "grey" to "gray" for consistency with other sections.

* Please format "grayWolves" and "blackWolves" as [[variables]].

Stub generator
* Please change "grey" to "gray" for consistency with other sections.

Thanks.
Wow, thanks a lot, was my 1st draft, really helpfull and clear <3
